meanings.definition: A failure to adjust appropriately to a situation or environment.
meanings.sent1: The maladaptation of the plant to the new soil led to its withering.
meanings.sent2: The maladaptation of the animal to the cold climate resulted in its migration.
meanings.sent3: The penguin's maladaptation to the warm weather made it wear a tiny sunhat.
meanings.sent4: The maladaptation of the car to the rough terrain was like a fish out of water.
meanings.sent5: The maladaptation of the student to the new school was evident in their struggle to make friends.

meanings.definition: The process of becoming poorly suited to a particular situation or environment.
meanings.sent1: The maladaptation of the building to the modern design trends was evident in its outdated appearance.
meanings.sent2: The maladaptation of the software to the new operating system caused frequent crashes.
meanings.sent3: The tree's maladaptation to the windy weather made it sway like a dancer.
meanings.sent4: The maladaptation of the clock to the new batteries was like trying to fit a square peg in a round hole.
meanings.sent5: The maladaptation of the book to the digital age was clear in its lack of an e-book version.
